page.title: 04Manufacturing in Chinley
page.content: In Chinley the textile industry hosts Dorma, which produces bed covers and blinds and pillow cases. Dorma belongs to the Vantona-Viyella Group, but produces its own branded goods. Dorma uses water from the Otter brook to be part of the dye and puts the remainder of the dye (after use) back into the river! Some days the Black Brook is the colour its name suggests, while at other times it can be grey, green or even bright purple! This pollution is unsightly, but it doesn't seem to harm the wildlife. Further up the road and to the right is the old Tramway. Follow this and up the road to the right and you come to Bernard Wardles, which produces bedroom utilities such as duvets. {by Martin Green
